alert.note: Alert for Brantley; Clinch; Inland Camden; Northeastern Charlton; Southern Ware; Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 1:04AM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Nassau, western Baker, Columbia, southeastern Suwannee, southeastern Hamilton, western Camden, south central Brantley, southeastern Ware, southeastern Clinch and Charlton Counties through 145 AM EST... At 103 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout over Winfield, or near Lake City, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lake City, Hilliard, Folkston, White Springs, Stephen Foster State Park, Columbia, Taylor, Homeland, Kings Ferry and Winfield. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EST for northern and northeastern Florida...and southeastern Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Brantley; Clinch; Inland Camden; Northeastern Charlton; Southern Ware; Western Charlton
